member.name: M:PX.BulkInsert.DataCompare.PointExtensionsForCompare.CompareAllTables(PX.DbServices.Points.Point,PX.DbServices.Points.Point,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},PX.BulkInsert.DataCompare.TablesColumnsFilter,PX.DbServices.Points.IExecutionObserver,System.String)
member.summary: Compares all tables of the source version database to those of the target version database. The method returns the number of tables where errors occurred.
member.param: The first data source (current implementation of the method requires that the value of the parameter must point to a database).
The second data source (accepts file system pointer).
The company identifier from the first data source.
The company identifier from the second data source.
The filter of identifiers for tables and columns, for example, it can be used when columns contain data known to be different, such as the GUIDs of wiki articles.
The instance of the class implementing the IExecutionObserver interface with execution event callbacks: advance to next table or throw of an exception.
The path to save delta records in XML format. (If this parameter is not specified, the current directory of the application is used.)

member.param: The connection to the database to which delta records will be applied.
The path to a folder with delta records in XML format (one XML file per table).
The identifier of the company whose data will be modified.
The instance of the class implementing the IExecutionObserver interface with execution event callbacks: advance to next table or throw of an exception.

member.name: T:PX.BulkInsert.DataCompare.TablesComparer
member.summary: The class that is used for building the delta of two databases.

member.name: M:PX.BulkInsert.DataCompare.TablesComparer.Compare(PX.DbServices.Points.ITableAdapter,PX.DbServices.QueryObjectModel.YaqlCondition,PX.DbServices.Model.DataSet.PxDataTable,System.Int32@,System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Compares the specified table of the source version database to that of the target version database. The method returns a sequence of commands used to reconcile the data of a source version table with the data of a target version table. Then the returned sequence can be saved in XML format by using the PX.BulkInsert.DataCompare.PointExtensionsForCompare.SaveToXml method.
member.param: An adapter for a database table of a source version.
A predicate to filter rows with (will be transformed into the WHERE condition when querying the database). For example, this parameter can be used to select data from the specified company.
Data of a target version database table which is loaded in a memory.
The number of read rows of source version database table.
An optional array where elements with true values specify the indexes of columns excluded from comparison.

member.name: T:PX.BulkInsert.Provider.BatchTransferExecutor
member.summary: Is used for creation of snapshots in asynchronous mode.

member.summary: Is used for creation of snapshots in synchronous mode.

member.name: T:PX.BulkInsert.CompanyDescription

member.name: T:PX.BulkInsert.DbmsMaintenance
member.summary: The base class for maintenance of a data point.

member.name: M:PX.BulkInsert.DbmsMaintenance.InsertRestartMark(System.Type)
member.summary: Inserts a mark for restarting multiple cluster nodes.

member.name: M:PX.BulkInsert.DbmsMaintenance.LogSystemEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a System Event log record, swallowing any exceptions (e.g. if an older version being upgraded has no SystemEvent table yet, or has an earlier version of the table).
member.param: Verbosity level.
Event source component (what produced the event). Must be on of the predefined string values. See , constants named with prefix 'CategoryName_...', except CategoryName_All.
EventID string constant that unambiguously specifies the event. See class for valid constant values.
Screen "identifier". Can be either canonical screen ID (AA112233) or a URI like "~/...[any_URL_segments_here]/getfile.ashx"
Tenant name. Specify if there is no tenant to pass.
User name. Specify if there is no user to pass.
Message text you want the users to see on "System Monitor" screen in "System Events" tab in "Details" column.

member.name: T:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallExecutionObserver
member.summary: The class that watches the progress of an operation launched by an object and handles the errors occurred when the operation is performed.
member.remarks: The ExternalInstallation constructor assigns a new instance of this class to the protected observer field of the new ExternalInstallation instance.

member.name: F:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallExecutionObserver.OnEvent
member.summary: A method that is executed if an error occurs during execution of a database operation.

member.name: M:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallExecutionObserver.#ctor(System.Func{PX.BulkInsert.SqlEvent,PX.BulkInsert.SqlEventReaction})
member.summary: Initializes the field with the passed method.
member.param: The method that processes errors during the database operations. If null is passed as the value of the parameter, the errors are ignored. The constructor assigns the value passed as this parameter to the OnEvent field.

member.summary: Initializes the field with an internal method.
member.param: The method that processes errors during the database operations.

member.summary: Defines which action is performed if an error occurs.
member.param: An error that occurs during the database operation.

member.name: F:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.CompanyAdminAccount.userName
member.summary: The username of the administrator.
member.remarks: The value can contain any Unicode characters. The length is less or equal to 64 characters.

member.name: F:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.CompanyAdminAccount.password
member.summary: The password of the administrator.
member.remarks: The value can contain any Unicode characters and can be empty.

member.name: F:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.CompanyAdminAccount.changePassOnLogin
member.summary: Indicates (if set to true) that the administrator must change the password during the first login.

member.summary: The structure that describes an operation over the company.

member.summary: The type of the operation.

member.name: F:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.CompanyOperation.Description
member.summary: The description of the company.

member.name: F:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.CompanyOperation.AdminUser
member.summary: The administrator of the company.

member.name: F:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.CompanyOperation.DataTypeName
member.summary: The name of the company template, which usually matches the name of the folder that contains XML or ADB files with the data of the company.

member.name: M:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.#ctor(PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ConnectionDefinition,System.String,System.Func{PX.BulkInsert.SqlEvent,PX.BulkInsert.SqlEventReaction})
member.param: The path to the Database folder of an Acumatica ERP installation.
The connection definition, which includes the location of the database instance, the name of the database, username and password to connect to the database, and other parameters.

A method that processes errors during the database operations. The ExternalInstallation constructor creates an instance of the ExternalInstallExecutionObserver class based on this method. The parameter is null by default, which means that the errors are ignored during processing.

member.name: M:PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.Run(System.Collections.Generic.List{PX.BulkInsert.Installer.ExternalInstallation.CompanyOperation},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Upgrades the database and performs the operations over the companies that are specified by the method. If the database does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The list of operations on the companies.

Indicates (if set to true) that the database schema update should be skipped. Default value is false. If the parameter is set to true, existing tables are updated to meet the new database structure. If the parameter is set to false, existing tables structure remains. This may lead to incompatibility between the current product and the database structure if they have different versions.

The administrator of the company. The value can be null if you don't need to create the default administrator user.

The type of the database, which is either MSSqlServer or MySql.

member.name: T:PX.BulkInsert.SpecialUpgrade.UserReports.UserReportUpgrader
member.summary: A supplementary interface that you can use to make an Acumatica Framework application or an Acumatica ERP add-on application update customized reports during the update to a newer version of the application or when an Acumatica ERP customization is being published. By using classes that implement this interface, the system updates the XML versions of reports that are stored in the database with the latest changes in data access classes (DACs).

code.title: Example
code.description: An example of the UserReportUpgrader interface implementation is shown in the following code. You can create this class in any part of your application's project.

member.name: P:PX.BulkInsert.SpecialUpgrade.UserReports.UserReportUpgrader.MaxVersionToUpgradeFrom

summary.para: Specifies the version of the class, which is the date when the class that implements the UserReportUpgrader interface was added.

member.remarks: This property is used to identify the classes that can update a report. For example, if the MaxVersionToUpgradeFrom property returns the value 20160713, which corresponds to July 13, 2016, the class that provides this implementation of the UserReportUpgrader interface can be used to update the reports that were created earlier than July 13, 2016.
member.value: You specify the date as an int value with the YYYYMMDD format.

member.name: P:PX.BulkInsert.SpecialUpgrade.UserReports.UserReportUpgrader.OrderNumber
member.summary: Specifies the order number of the class in the sequence of update classes. You can use this property to specify the order of classes to be used for update in case when MaxVersion values are equal for several implementations of UserReportUpgrader interface.

summary.para: Performs the update of a report. The method is called for a report that was created earlier than the date specified in the MaxVersionToUpgradeFrom property.

param.name: entity
param.para: A System.XML.XmlElement object that contains a report to be updated.

returns.para: The method returns a System.XML.XmlElement object that contains an updated report.

code.title: Example
code.description: An example of the UserReportUpgrader interface implementation is shown in the following code. You can create this class in any part of your applicationâ€™s project.
